ResourceHeader.ResourceName: The Ulysses Catalog of Solar Hard X-Ray Flares

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata
Added MetadataRightsList. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Updated to 2.7.1. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description:
The Ulysses Catalog of Solar Hard X-Ray Flares is a comprehensive, 13-year dataset (1990–2003+) from the Solar X-ray/Cosmic Gamma-Ray Burst (GRB) instrument, covering solar flares with 15-150 keV hard X-ray spectra. Due to its unique, out-of-ecliptic orbit, the instrument provided stereoscopic observations of flares, including those hidden from Earth-orbiting satellites, allowing analysis of "thermal feed-through" and coronal components.
See publication DOI 10.1007/s11207-009-9387-9

PublicationInfo.Title: The Ulysses Catalog of Solar Hard X-Ray Flares
PublicationInfo.Authors: Tranquille, C.; Hurley, K.; Hudson, H. S.
PublicationInfo.PublishedBy:
Solar Physics: A Journal for Solar and Solar-Stellar Research and the
Study of Solar Terrestrial Physics, 258(1)

Catalog.ProviderName: eScholarship, UC Berkeley Previously Published Works

Parameter.Name: Data availability
Parameter.Description:
Column indicates whether the flare is seen as a count rate increase in the Ulysses data (Y) or not (N), or whether it is not known (?) due to
missing telemetry or to a high background caused by in situ charged particles.

Parameter.Name: F – S – U angle
Parameter.Description: Flare – Sun – Ulysses (F – S – U) angle in degrees

Parameter.Name: Peak GRB
Parameter.Description: The column provides the peak count rate (non-normalized and corrected for rollover and dead time effects where necessary) measured by GRB during the event if seen.
